meanings.definition: A large flightless seabird of the southern hemisphere, with black upper parts and white underparts and wings.
meanings.sent1: The penguin waddled gracefully on the icy shore.
meanings.sent2: I saw a penguin swimming in the cold ocean.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penguin bring a suitcase to the beach? To have a 'seal'-cation!
meanings.sent4: In a world full of soaring eagles, be a proud penguin standing tall.
meanings.sent5: The penguin's tuxedo-like appearance makes it stand out among other birds.

meanings.definition: A type of aquatic bird that is unable to fly, found in the southern hemisphere.
meanings.sent1: The penguin colony huddled together for warmth.
meanings.sent2: Penguins are excellent swimmers, gliding through the water effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: What did the penguin wear to the party? A 'beak'-ini!
meanings.sent4: She felt as grounded as a penguin in the vast sky of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The penguin's inability to fly doesn't stop it from exploring the depths of the ocean.
